items.label: notation-keff-superscripts
items.title: k_eff Superscript Convention
items.content:
246: :label: notation-keff-superscripts
247: 
248: When we write "$k_{\text{eff}}$" without superscript, the scale should be clear from context:
249: - If discussing softmax, companion selection, or measurements $d_j$: assume $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}$
250: - If discussing localization weights $w_{ij}$, localized moments $\mu_\rho, \sigma_\rho$: assume $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}$
251: 
252: For clarity in proofs, **always use superscript notation** $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}$ or $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}$.

250: - If discussing localization weights $w_{ij}$, localized moments $\mu_\rho, \sigma_\rho$: assume $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}$
